top_categories.workout_context: 50ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At Waukon 100, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Waukon 100. Train it until it feels boring.
At mile 60 of 100, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
Waukon 100's Iowa rolling, Local event forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 100 miles.
5,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Waukon 100's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before June.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 100 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
100 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.
Two threshold sessions per week without the recovery cost of VO2max work. For 100 miles, sustainable FTP gains matter more than peak power.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Waukon 100, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Tempo is Waukon 100's race pace. The wattage you'll hold for 100 miles on Iowa rolling gravel. Train it until it's automatic.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Waukon 100’s 100 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Waukon 100 requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on iowa rolling gravel to build confidence. Expect: iowa rolling, local event, midwest gravel.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Over Under, and G Spot to prepare you for 100 miles of iowa rolling gravel in Waukon, Iowa.
